## insertIf() function

Returns the provided elements wrap in an array if the given condition turns to be truthy. It is meant as immutable alternative of the method push on the Array structure. The consumer should then unwrap the boxed elements by mean on spreading operation. Since the JS spread operator disregards the empty array, it won't modify the original structure in case of falsy condition.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function insertIf<Condition, Elements extends unknown[]>(condition: Condition, ...elements: readonly [...Elements]): readonly [...Elements] | readonly [];
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  condition | Condition | A whatsoever value that will be checked for truthiness by mean of boolean type coercion! |
|  elements | readonly \[...Elements\] | The elements to conditionally returns if the <code>condition</code> is truthy |

<b>Returns:</b>

readonly \[...Elements\] \| readonly \[\]

The provided elements boxed in an array or an empty array

## Example


```ts
const array = [
    ...insertIf(false, -2, -1, 0),
    1,
    2,
    ...insertIf(true, 3, 4, 5, 6),
] as const;
console.log(array); // => [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
```
